sixmensmorris

Class BoardView

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • sixmensmorris.Screen
              • sixmensmorris.BoardView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class BoardView
extends Screen
    Creates the information that the controller will access in order to communicate to the user. The controller will call the view and this is what will draw the graphics to the application window.
    Version:
    1
    Author:
    Kelvin Lin, Jeremy Klotz
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • pieceNotTaken

        public boolean pieceNotTaken(int number)
        This method will allow us to make sure the user can only place one piece per node on the board.
        Parameters:
        number - The location of the piece
        Returns:
        a boolean value that determines if a piece is already placed in a location FALSE, a piece is already there.

      • getBoardStates

        public int[] getBoardStates()
        Return the state of the board (player Red or player Blue).
        Returns:
        the state of the board (player Red or player Blue).

      • setBoardState

        public void setBoardState(int number,
                          int state)
        Set the state of the board.
        Parameters:
        number - is the specific index of the array of states
        state - will be the previous state of the board and will be updated

      • getBoardState

        public int getBoardState(int number)
        Returns the current state of the board from accessing getPieceState. Number is the number used to index the array of states.
        Parameters:
        number - is the number used to index the array of states.
        Returns:
        The current state of the board from accessing getPieceState.

      • getCircles

        public Circle[] getCircles()
        Return the array of all circles in the board
        Returns:
        the array of all circles in the board

      • setStates

        public void setStates(int[] states)
        Set the states of the game.
        Parameters:
        states - is the array of states (black, red, blue)

      • draw

        private void draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draw the entire board. This method is used for consistency among other views.
        Parameters:
        g - is used to access and manipulate Java's awt library.

      • drawRectangle

        private void drawRectangle(java.awt.Graphics g,
                           Rectangle rect)
        Draws a black rectangle (layer / square) that updates based on window size.
        Parameters:
        g - is used to access and manipulate Java's awt library.
        rect - will take in an initialized rectangle and update it accordingly.
        See Also:
        Rectangle

      • drawCircle

        private void drawCircle(java.awt.Graphics g,
                        Circle circle,
                        int state)
        Draws a coloured circle based on current state of the board.
        Parameters:
        g - is used to access Java's awt library.
        circle - takes in an initialized circle.
        state - is the current state of the board 0 = black, 1 = blue , 2 = red

      • drawLine

        private void drawLine(java.awt.Graphics g,
                      Point a,
                      Point b)
        Draw a line from point a to b. This will be used to connect layers.
        Parameters:
        g - is used to access Java's awt library.
        a - is the starting point.
        b - is the ending point.
        See Also:
        drawMiddleLines

      • drawBoardCircles

        private void drawBoardCircles(java.awt.Graphics g,
                              Rectangle rect,
                              int layer)
        Draw all circles needed for the board.
        Parameters:
        g - is used to access Java's awt library.
        rect - is the rectangle corresponding to the layer.
        layer - in this assignment is the first or second rectangle(more layers can be added).

      • drawMiddleLines

        private void drawMiddleLines(java.awt.Graphics g,
                             Rectangle rect)
        Connect the layers of the board together through the midpoints of inner layers.
        Parameters:
        g - is used to access Java's awt library.
        rect - is used to access the midpoints from the ADT.
        See Also:
        drawLine, Rectangle

      • drawBoard

        private void drawBoard(java.awt.Graphics g,
                       int N)
        Draw the entire board based on pre-determined scaling constants.
        Parameters:
        g - is used to access Java's awt library.
        N - is the number of layers / rectangles.
        See Also:
        Rectangle, Point

      • updateScreen

        public void updateScreen()
        Updates the screen. If whole screen needs to be repained, repaint the whole thing. Otherwise, repaint the errors.
        Specified by:
        updateScreen in class Screen

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        public boolean existsOnlyMills(int colour)
        Returns whether there are only mills left for a given colour
        Parameters:
        colour - The colour to check
        Returns:
        Whether there are only mills left for the given colour

      • checkWinner

        public int checkWinner()
        Returns the winner of the board
        Returns:
        1 if blue is the winner, 2 if red is the winner, 0 otherwise

        Returns the number of repeated moves from the board model

        The number of repeated moves
